'Dimethylamine' is an organic compound with the formula
(CH 3) 2NH. This secondary amine is a colorless, flammable
gas with an ammonia-like odor. Dimethylamine is commonly encountered
commercially as a solution in water at concentrations up to around 40%. In 2005,
an estimated 270,000 tons were produced industrially, A. B. van
Gysel, W. Musin "Methylamines" in Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial
Chemistry, 2005 Wiley-VCH Verlag, Weinheim.  but it is also found as a
natural product.
